intro: Cnicus casabonae, commonly known as the Casablanca daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that produces bright yellow flowers with white centers, resembling daisies. The plant has silver-gray foliage and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often used in rock gardens and as a border plant due to its ornamental value. Cnicus casabonae is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
